export var questionObj = {
  "Qtext": "

Consider the figure given below. CDE is a triangle. F is a point on the side DE of CDE triangle such that \(\angle CFE = \angle DCE \). Given \(DC = 7 \) cm, \(CE = 6 \) cm, and \(FE = 1 \) cm,
\begin{itemize}
\item Prove that \(\Delta CDE \sim \Delta FCE \)
\item Find the lengths of DE and CF 
\item Find ratio of areas of triangles CDE and FCE 
\end{itemize}
tikzpicture{}
\newline

",
  "Steps": [{
    "id": "s1",
    "n_params": 0,
    "step_txt": "In the triangles CDE and FCE we have
\[
	\angle DCE = \angle CFE 
\]
\[
	\angle CED = \angle CEF 
\]
So, we can write that
\[
	\Delta CDE \sim \Delta FCE 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{CD }{CF } = \frac{CE }{FE } = \frac{DE }{CE }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{7 }{CF } = \frac{6 }{1 } = \frac{DE }{6 }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{7 }{CF } = \frac{6 }{1 } \textrm{ and } \frac{DE }{6 } = \frac{6 }{1 } 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow CF = 1.17 \textrm{ and } DE = 36.0 
\]
Now, we can write
\[
	\frac{\textrm{area of } \Delta CDE }{\textrm{area of }\Delta FCE } = \frac{CE ^2 }{FE ^2 } = \frac{36 }{1 }
\]
\[
	= 36.0
\]
\newline
"
  }]
};
export var resp = [{
  "data": [],
  "text": " "
}];

sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "

Consider the figure given below. CDE is a triangle. F is a point on the side DE of CDE triangle such that \(\angle CFE = \angle DCE \). Given \(DC = 7 \) cm, \(CE = 6 \) cm, and \(FE = 1 \) cm,
\begin{itemize}
\item Prove that \(\Delta CDE \sim \Delta FCE \)
\item Find the lengths of DE and CF 
\item Find ratio of areas of triangles CDE and FCE 
\end{itemize}
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 0, "step_txt": "In the triangles CDE and FCE we have
\[
	\angle DCE = \angle CFE 
\]
\[
	\angle CED = \angle CEF 
\]
So, we can write that
\[
	\Delta CDE \sim \Delta FCE 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{CD }{CF } = \frac{CE }{FE } = \frac{DE }{CE }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{7 }{CF } = \frac{6 }{1 } = \frac{DE }{6 }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{7 }{CF } = \frac{6 }{1 } \textrm{ and } \frac{DE }{6 } = \frac{6 }{1 } 
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow CF = 1.17 \textrm{ and } DE = 36.0 
\]
Now, we can write
\[
	\frac{\textrm{area of } \Delta CDE }{\textrm{area of }\Delta FCE } = \frac{CE ^2 }{FE ^2 } = \frac{36 }{1 }
\]
\[
	= 36.0
\]
\newline
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [], "text": " "}]
